law.catch_line: Corporate powers of fair board -- Minutes and records of meetings -- Quorum.

text.section: The State Fair Board shall be a body corporate with the usual corporate powers. Full minutes and records shall be kept of all meetings of the board and all official actions of the board shall be recorded therein, and such minutes and records shall constitute public records and be available at all reasonable times for public inspection.
A quorum of the board shall consist of five (5) members, and a majority of those present at any meeting of the board may act for the board upon any matter which may legally come before such meeting.

law.history: Amended 1950 Ky. Acts ch. 217, sec. 1. -- Amended 1946 Ky. Acts ch. 80, sec. 2. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 4618i-2, 4618i-6.
